d:entry.d:title: (front/back matter)
d:entry.p: Based on the word lists from the Logical Language Group of the 1990s

d:dictionary.d:entry:
puzu
cmavo ( selma'o: PU* )
time tense: a long time before
(tense/modal)
Frequency: undefined null

vu'i
cmavo ( selma'o: LAhE )
sumti qualifier: the sequence made from set or composed of elements/components
order is vague
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is the answer/response/solution/[reply] to question/problem x2

d:entry.p: (cf. ciksi, frati, preti, nabmi, spuda for agentive response/reply, cpedu)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
le'o
cmavo ( selma'o: UI5 )
attitudinal modifier: aggressive - passive - defensive
(cf. gunta, bandu)
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 (agent) inserts/interposes/puts/deposits x2 into interior x3/into among/between members of x

d:entry.p: [insertion need not imply a significant degree of 'filling'; inject (= je'erse'a); syringe/needle (= se'arterje'e, je'erse'atci, jestu'u or tu'urjesni); also pour, inflate, stuff, fill]; (cf. rinci, tisna, punji, jbini, nenri, jmina, culno, kunti, catlu)

ul.li: x1 reflects Urdu language/culture/nationality in aspect x2
(adjective:) x1 is bent/crooked/not straight or direct/[twisted]/folded

d:entry.p: (cf. cinje, klupe, kruvi, polje, sarlu, sirji, bargu, genxu)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
be'e
cmavo ( selma'o: COI )
vocative: request to send/speak
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is born to x2 at time x3 [birthday] and place x4 [birthplace]
x1 is native to (fo) x4

d:entry.p: [x2 bears/gives birth to x1; also x3: natal day]; (cf. fange, gutra, rorci, mamta, salci, citsi)

ul.li: x1 is an atom of element/atomic number x2 of isotope number/atomic weight x3

d:entry.p: (cf. kantu for a basic unit of a property or activity; selci for a basic physical subunit, generally of a mass)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
bu'u
cmavo ( selma'o: FAhA3 )
location tense relation/direction
coincident with/at the same place as
space equivalent of ca
Frequency: undefined null

sekai ma
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
sumti question asking for a characteristic property/quality
which?
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 seems/appears to have property(ies) x2 to observer x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: [also: x1 seems like it has x2 to x3; suggest belief/observation (= mlugau, mluti'i); looks like/resembles (= smimlu, mitmlu)]; (cf. catlu, viska, simsa, zgana, ganse, jarco)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
pi'o
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI )
pilno modal, 1st place used by ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is gray [color adjective]

d:dictionary.d:entry:
foi
cmavo ( selma'o: FOI )
terminator: end composite lerfu
never elidable
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 prevents/keeps/stops/restrains/constrains event x2 from occurring

d:entry.p: (cf. pinfu, bandu, zunti, rinju, jimte, bapli, rivbi)

ul.li: x1 is certain/sure/positive/convinced that x2 is true

d:entry.p: (cf. jetnu, jinvi, krici, djuno, senpi, sruma)

ul.li: x1 (event) defends/protects x2 (object/state) from threat/peril/potential x3 (event)

d:entry.p: [also secures (verb); x1 wards/resists x3; protective cover/shield (= badgai)]; (cf. ckape, fanta, fapro, marbi, rivbi, zunti, snura, binra, lunbe, pulji)

ul.li: x1 is small in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3
x1 is/appears to be of color/hue x2 as perceived/seen by x3 under conditions x4

d:entry.p: [conditions may include lighting, background, etc.]; (cf. blanu, bunre, cicna, cinta, crino, grusi, narju, nukni, pelxu, xunre, zirpu, carmi, kandi, xekri, blabi)

ul.li: x1 is friction [force opposing motion] due to contact/rubbing between x2 and x3
(fe) x2 rubs x

d:entry.p: [also x2 scrubs/wipes/brushes (against) x3 (= seltermosra); non-agentive rub (= termosra)]; (cf. sakli, sraku, jabre, satre, guska, pencu, spali)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
nu'a
cmavo ( selma'o: NUhA )
convert mathematical expression (mex) operator to a selbri/tanru component
Frequency: undefined null

fi'e
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI )
finti modal, 1st place (creator) created by ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a/the abdomen/belly/lower trunk [body-part] of x2
[metaphor: midsection]

d:entry.p: [also stomach (= djaruntyrango), digestive tract (= befctirango, befctirangyci'e)]; (cf. cutne, livga, canti)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
ro'anai
cmavo ( selma'o: UI*4 )
emotion category/modifier: social - antisocial
Frequency: undefined null

bimoi
cmavo ( selma'o: MOI* )
quantified selbri: convert 8 to ordinal selbri
x1 is eighth among x2 ordered by rule x3
Frequency: undefined null

ba'i
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI )
basti modal, 1st place replaced by ...
Frequency: undefined null

seta'i
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
tadji modal, 2nd place methodically
as a method for doing ...
Frequency: undefined null

vo'o
cmavo ( selma'o: KOhA4 )
pro-sumti: repeats 4th place of main bridi of this sentence
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is military/regimented/is strongly organized/prepared by system x2 for purpose x3

d:entry.p: [also paramilitary; soldier in its broadest sense - not limited to those trained/organized as part of an army to defend a state (= bilpre)]; (cf. jenmi for a military force, sonci, ganzu, pulji)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
lau
cmavo ( selma'o: LAU )
2-word letteral/shift: punctuation mark or special symbol follows
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 (du'u) contradicts/denies/refutes/negates x2 (du'u) under rules/logic x3

d:entry.p: [also exception (= nafmupli); agentive contradict/deny (= nafxu'a or tolxu'a)]; (cf. nibli, tugni, zanru, xusra)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
lo'e
cmavo ( selma'o: LE )
veridical descriptor: the typical one(s) who really is(are) ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 utters moan/groan/howl/scream [non-linguistic utterance] x2 expressing x3 (property)

d:entry.p: [also shriek, most animal sounds, e.g. bark, cackle, meow, neigh, moo, honk, baa, crow] (cf. krixa, bacru, cusku, cortu)

ul.li: x1 [energy] is light/illumination illuminating x2 from light source x3

d:entry.p: [x3 illuminates/lights x2 with light/illumination x1; x2 is lit/illuminated by illumination x1 from source x3 (= selgu'i for reordered places); light/lamp (= tergu'i)](cf. dirce, manku, solri, carmi, ctino, kantu)

ul.li: x1 is a bottle/jar/urn/flask/closable container for x2, made of material x3 with lid x4

d:entry.p: (cf. baktu, lante, patxu, tansi, tanxe, vasru, gacri)

ul.li: x1 is a/the argument of predicate/function x2 filling place x3 (kind/number)

d:entry.p: (x1 and x2 are text); (cf. bridi, darlu, gismu)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
fe'i
cmavo ( selma'o: VUhU1 )
n-ary mathematical operator: divided by
division operator
[(((a / b) / c) / ...)]
Frequency: undefined null

na'u
cmavo ( selma'o: NAhU )
convert selbri to mex operator
used to create less-used operators using le'avla, lujvo, etc.
Frequency: undefined null

li'anai
cmavo ( selma'o: UI*3 )
discursive: clearly - obscurely
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a berry (fruit/plant) of plant/species x2
x1 (person) is lazy/avoiding work/effort concerning action x2
x1 (du'u) is true/truth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x2

d:entry.p: [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; (cf. stace, jitfa, fatci, birti, cfika)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
pamei
cmavo ( selma'o: MOI* )
quantified selbri: convert 1 to cardinal selbri
x1 is a set with single/sole/only member x2
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a cell/atom/unit/molecule of x2
x1 is an indivisible, most basic subunit of x2

d:entry.p: (x2 generally has mass nature); (cf. kantu for properties, activities; ratni, gradu)

ul.li: x1 is a vehicle/mode of transport carrying x2 in/on surface/medium x3, propelled by x4

d:entry.p: (cf. klama, matra, bevri, bloti, carce, karce, sabnu, skiji)

ul.li: x1 [person/agent] is an agentive cause of event x2
x1 does/brings about x2

d:entry.p: (cf. cmavo list gau, gunka, zukte, rinka, fasnu for non-agentive events, jibri, kakne, pilno)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
za'a
cmavo ( selma'o: UI2 )
evidential: I observe
(cf. zgana, lanli)
Frequency: undefined null

ru'e
cmavo ( selma'o: CAI )
attitudinal: weak intensity attitude modifier
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 [person/passive/state] undergoes/experiences x2 (event/experience)
x2 happens to x1

d:entry.p: [also has/have (of events/experiences); (adjective:) x1 is empirical; suggests passive undergoing but does not exclude active (per zukte) intent; a deserved experience: reward or punishment (= jernyfri, zanjernyfri, maljernyfri)]; (cf. cmavo list ri'i, jmive, fasnu, renvi)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
ji'i
cmavo ( selma'o: PA4 )
digit/number: approximately (default the typical value in this context) (number)
Frequency: undefined null

re'u
cmavo ( selma'o: ROI )
converts number to an objectively quantified ordinal tense interval modifier
defaults to time
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a voice/speech sound of individual x2

d:dictionary.d:entry:
teka'a
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
klama modal, 3rd place with origin ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a cover/[lid/top] for covering/concealing/sheltering x2

d:entry.p: (cf. pilka, gapru, marbi, drudi, ve botpi, bitmu, calku)

ul.li: x1 is a slice [thin flat portion] of x2 (mass)
x1 is a pot/kettle/urn/tub/sink, a deep container for contents x2, of material/properties x3

d:entry.p: (cf. tansi, palne for depth; baktu, botpi for open/lidded)

ul.li: x1 falls/drops to x2 from x3 in gravity well/frame of reference x4

d:entry.p: [note: things can fall in spin, thrust, or tide as well as gravity; (agentive "drop" = one of two lujvo: falcru and falri'a)] (cf. lafti, cpare, klama, sfubu)

ul.li: x1 (agent) invests resources x2 in investment x3 expecting return/profit x4 (object(s)/event)

d:entry.p: [also ties up/[risks/gambles]; x1 is an investor; x2 are invested assets of x1; bond (= jertervle)]; (cf. prali, canja, jbera, dejni, ponse)

ul.li: 2nd assignable variable predicate (context determines place structure)
x1 is a blade of tool/weapon x2

d:entry.p: (cf. dakfu, tunta, tutci, guska, kinli, katna)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
vi'u
cmavo ( selma'o: VIhA )
dimensionality of space interval tense: 3-space interval
throughout a space
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a/the pubic area/external genitalia [body-part] of x2

d:entry.p: (cf. cinse, gletu, pinji, vibna, vlagi, ganti, mabla)

tr.td: cf. 陰毛 (阴毛) [yīn máo] ``pubic hair'' (component)

ul.li: x1 is a pen using ink x2 applied by process x3
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of coal/peat/anthracite/bituminous from source x2

d:dictionary.d:entry:
po'i
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI )
porsi modal, 1st place (in order) sequentially
in the sequence ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 feels wonder/awe/marvels about x2

d:entry.p: (cf. cinmo, makfa, kucli, spaji, cinri, banli, sisku)

ul.li: x1 is a fish of species x2 [metaphorical extension to sharks, non-fish aquatic vertebrates]
x1 isn't the-same-thing-as/is different-from/other-than x2 by standard x3
x1 is something else

tr.td: cf. 其它 [qí tā] ``other'' (compound); cf. 他 [tā] ``he'' (variant); cf. 其他 [qí tā] ``other''

ul.li: x1 is slow/sluggish at doing/being/bringing about x2 (event/state)
x1 is in the future of/later than/after x2 in time sequence
x1 is latter
x2 is former

d:entry.p: [also sequel, succeed, successor, follow, come(s) after; time ordering only (use lidne otherwise); aorist in that x1 may overlap in time with x2 as long as it extends afterwards; non-aorist future (= cfabalvi); (default x2 is the space time reference, whereupon:) x1 will occur]; (cf. lidne, cabna, purci, farna)

ul.li: x1 (action) is clumsy/awkward by standard x2
x1 is automatic in function x2 under conditions x3
x1 thirsts for x2
x1 needs/wants drink/fluid/lubrication x2
x1 is a quantity of protein/albumin of type x2 composed of amino acids (sequence/jo'u)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
veme'a
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
mleca modal, 4th place (relative!) less than by amount ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 invents/creates/composes/authors x2 for function/purpose x3 from existing elements/ideas x4

d:entry.p: [x1 is creative/inventive]; (cf. cmavo list fi'e, ciska, pemci, zbasu, larcu, specific works of authorship, prosa, skina)

ul.li: x1 is an elephant of species/breed x2
x1 is tired/fatigued by effort/situation x2 (event)
x1 needs/wants rest
x1 is fast/swift/quick/hastes/rapid at doing/being/bringing about x2 (event/state)
x1 reflects/mirrors/echoes x2 [object/radiation] to observer/point x3 as x4
x2 bounces on x1

d:entry.p: [also: x1 is a mirror/reflector]; [x2 may be light, lu'e of an imaged object; x4 may be image or echo or the same as x2 if physical object; x3 may be a path for a bounced object; ka is reflection]; (cf. catlu, viska, lenjo, pensi)

ul.li: x1 [ideal] is the conceptual shape/form of object/abstraction/manifestation x2 (object/abstract

d:entry.p: [also pattern; x1 is the mathematical or theoretical ideal form, while x2 is an object/event manifesting that form; e.g. circular/circle-shaped (= cukseltai) vs. circle (=cuktai, while cukla alone is ambiguous); model (= ci'ersaptai, saptai, ci'ersmitai, smitai)]; (cf. nejni, morna; te marji for physical shape, tapla, bliku, kubli, kurfa, cukla, mapti, morna, sarlu)

tr.td: FIXIT dubious; cf. 形態 (形态) [xíng tài] ``shape'' (compound)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
ji'ima'u
cmavo ( selma'o: PA* )
rounded up (appended after string of digits indicating a rounded value)
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a camera/photographic equipment recording illumination type x2 images to medium x3

tr.td: 照相機/照相机/zhào xiàng jī
cf. 照像機 (照像机) [zhào xiàng jī] ``camera'' (variant)

ul.li: x1 arches/curves over/around x2 and is made of x3
x1 is an arch over/around x2 of material x3

d:entry.p: [also arc; x2 need not be an object, but may be a point or volume]; (cf. cripu, kruvi, korcu, condi)

ul.li: x1 desires/wants/wishes x2 (event/state) for purpose x3

d:entry.p: [if desire is for an object, this is sumti-raising; use tu'a in x2 (or use lujvo = po'edji)]; (cf. taske, xagji, mukti, nitcu, nelci, pacna, prami, rigni, trina, xebni, xlura)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
de
cmavo ( selma'o: KOhA1 )
logically quantified existential pro-sumti: there exists something 2 (usually restricted)
Frequency: undefined null

goi
cmavo ( selma'o: GOI )
sumti assignment
used to define/assign ko'a/fo'a series pro-sumti
Latin 'sive'
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a parcel/expanse of land at location x2
x1 is terrain

d:entry.p: (cf. vacri, xamsi; tutra, which need not be land, gugde, xamsi)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
mu'a
cmavo ( selma'o: UI3 )
discursive: for example - omitting - end examples
(cf. mupli)
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is regular/cyclical/periodic in property (ka)/activity x2 with period/interval x3

d:entry.p: [also uniform; resonant (= dikslicai)]; (cf. slilu, rilti, xutla, manfo, boxna)

ul.li: x1 exceeds/is beyond limit/boundary x2 from x3 in property/amount x4 (ka/ni)

d:entry.p: [on the other side of a bound, but not necessarily directly 'across' nor at the shortest plausible distance (per ragve); also not limited to position in space]; (cf. dukse, ragve, zmadu, kuspe)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of/made from/consists of wool [tight curly hair] from animal/species/source x2

d:entry.p: (cf. kosta, kumte, lanme, kanba, bukpu, kerfa)

ul.li: x1 possesses/owns/has x2 under law/custom x3
x1 is owner/proprietor of x2 under x3

d:entry.p: (x3 is generally more important to the concept than commonly accepted for the English equivalent, since the concept is broader when unconstrained, and the nature/interpretation of possession/ownership is very culturally dependent); (cf. ckini, ralte, jitro, steci, srana, tutra, turni, zivle)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
cimoi
cmavo ( selma'o: MOI* )
quantified selbri: convert 3 to ordinal selbri
x1 is third among x2 ordered by rule x3
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a passport issued to x2 (person) by authority x3 allowing x4 (activity)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
raumoi
cmavo ( selma'o: MOI* )
quantified selbri: converts enough to ordinal
x1 is enoughth among x2, order rule x3
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 reflects Hispano-American culture/nationalities in aspect x2

d:entry.p: [refers to Spanish-speaking Latin-American countries, not Brazil/Guyana]; (cf. merko, mexno, spano, ketco, bemro, gento)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
mau
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI )
zmadu modal, 1st place (a greater) exceeded by ...
usually a sumti modifier
Frequency: undefined null

ko'e
cmavo ( selma'o: KOhA4 )
pro-sumti: he/she/it/they #2 (specified by goi)
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 walks/strides/paces on surface x2 using limbs x3
x1 is a/the brow/forehead [projecting flat/smooth head/body-part] of x2

d:dictionary.d:entry:
ma'u
cmavo ( selma'o: PA3 )
digit/number: plus sign
positive number
default any positive
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 exists/is real/actual/reality for x2 under metaphysics x3

d:entry.p: [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; [x1 is physical (one sense)]; (cf. fatci, xanri)

ul.li: x1 is a bee/wasp/hornet of species/breed x2
x1 is surface/face [bounded shape/form] of [higher-dimension] object x2, on side x3, edges x4

d:entry.p: [also x4 bounds]; (cf. crane, flira, plita, bliku)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
no
cmavo ( selma'o: PA1 )
digit/number: 0 (digit) [zero]
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a shovel/spade [bladed digging implement] for digging x2
x1 is a sign/symbol/signal representing/referring/signifying/meaning x2 to observer x3

d:entry.p: [also: x1 signifies x2; (adjective:) x1 is significant/meaningful/of import; signal an action (= sniti'i), connotation (= se sibyti'isni, sibyti'ismu)]; (cf. lerfu, tcita, barna, mifra, smuni)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
fe'eca'o
cmavo ( selma'o: ZAhO* )
location event contour tense: continuative in space
throughout the place of ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a/the sweat/perspiration from body x2, excreted by gland(s)/organs x3
x1 is broken/inoperable/broken down/non-utile/not usable for function x2

d:entry.p: [agentive break, cause to become inoperable (= pofygau, pofyzu'e); accidentally break, as a result of an event, non-agentive (= pofyja'e, nutpo'uja'e)]; (cf. daspo, katna, porpi, se xrani, cikre)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
seka'a
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
klama modal, 2nd place with destination ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of oats [grain] of species/strain x2
x1 (agent) polishes object/surface x2 with polish x3, applied using tool x4
x1 is evil/depraved/wicked [morally bad] by standard x2

d:dictionary.d:entry:
sekai
cmavo ( selma'o: BAI* )
ckaji modal, 2nd place (quality) characterized by ...
with property ...
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is 1x10**-18 of x2 in dimension/aspect x3 (default is units)

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

ul.li: x1 [person] agrees with person(s)/position/side x2 that x3 (du'u) is true about matter x4

d:entry.p: (cf. sarxe, mapti, darlu, natfe, panpi, sarji)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
fe'eco'a
cmavo ( selma'o: ZAhO* )
location event contour tense: initiative in space
on this edge of ...
Frequency: undefined null

gu'onai
cmavo ( selma'o: GUhA* )
logical connective: tanru-internal forethought exclusive or (with gi)
Latin 'aut'
Frequency: undefined null

tu
cmavo ( selma'o: KOhA6 )
pro-sumti: that yonder
distant demonstrative it
indicated thing far from speaker&listener
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is an article/descriptor labelling description x2 (text) in language x3 with semantics x4

d:entry.p: [x2 is the noun phrase/sumti without the article/descriptor; description ((x1 with x2) = gadysu'i); note: 'determiner' has become the accepted general linguistics term, displacing 'article'; however, 'determiner' includes all words that can introduce a noun phrase/sumti, whether a description or not, such as pronoun possessives like lemi, quantifiers (especially in indefinites) like ci and su'o, and demonstratives like ti, ta, and tu; the term 'descriptor' in Lojban, is limited to words that introduce descriptions (excluding indefinites), such as those of selma'o LA and LE, their common compounds such as lemi, and possibly lenu]; 'article' typically refers only to a single word; Lojban assumes the broader meaning] (cf. valsi, cmavo)

ul.li: x1 copulates/fucks/mates/has coitus/sexual intercourse with x2

d:entry.p: [x1 and x2 are symmetrical; mounts (= cpanygle)]; (cf. cinse, pinji, plibu, vibna, vlagi, mabla, speni)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
.ija
cmavo ( selma'o: JA* )
logical connective: sentence afterthought or
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is vertical/upright/erect/plumb/oriented straight up and down in reference frame/gravity x2
x1 is a quantity of/contains/is made of bronze of composition including x2
x1 is a shoal [shallow hazard]/reef of material x2 in body of water x3
x1 [member] is rare/unusual/uncommon/atypical in property x2 (ka) among members of x3 (set)

d:entry.p: (x3 is complete specification of set); (cf. cizra, fadni, cafne, kampu, cnano - the generalized opposite to any/all of these concepts)

ul.li: x1 is a volitional entity employing means/taking action x2 for purpose/goal x3/to end x3

d:entry.p: [also acting at, undertaking, doing; agentive cause with volition/purpose; also x3 objective, end]; (cf. cmavo list zu'e, bapli, gunka, jalge, krinu, mukti, rinka, snuti, gasnu, fasnu, minji, prenu, ciksi, jibri, pilno, pluta, tadji, tutci)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
xy
cmavo ( selma'o: BY2 )
letteral for x
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is a spoon/scoop (tool) for use x2, made of material x3
x1 smiles/grins (facial expression)

d:entry.p: [smile/grin at something (= cismyfra)]; (cf. xajmi, cmila, frumu)

ul.li: x1 [amount] is the price of x2 to purchaser/consumer x3 set by vendor x4

d:entry.p: [x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posydi'a, posyseldi'a for unambiguous semantics); price is something decided/set by the seller, and is closely akin to offer (friti), which is what a buyer may decide; (note that price is not he same as cost/expense, which is the actual amount exchanged in a transaction; the latter is vecnu or canja; neither is the same as "value" or vamji; in colloquial English, these are sometimes interchanged, at least partially because of the rarity of barter and bargaining in the marketplace)]; (cf. canja, friti, janta, jdini, kargu, pleji, dapma, vamji for 'value', ve vecnu for 'cost', canja, fepni, jerna, jinga, pleji, prali, rupnu, sfasa, vamji)

d:entry.p: [reveal (= tolmipygau, mipyja'o, sivja'o); also: x1 shows that x2, x1 shows off x2; showing an object is generally expressed with a tu'a x2, since the properties of the shown object (other than its presence) intended for observation are seldom specified (simple presence could be expressed by leka [object] cu zvati)]; (cf. tigni, cipra, zgana, jvinu, lanli, mipri, simlu)

d:entry.p: [x3 need not be a container, but could merely be a site/location restriction; e.g. a heap. The sumti indicates how the supply is identified and distinguished from other occurrences of the stored x2 that are not part of the store]; (cf. panka; vreji for information storage; sabji for a store or reserve that is not necessarily tied to a site, banxa, panka)

tr.td: cf. 儲藏 (储藏) [chǔ cáng] ``store'' (compound); cf. 短時儲 (短时储) [duǎn shí chǔ] ``store'' (compound); cf. 蓄 [xù] ``store'' (variant); cf. 胥 [xū] ``store'' (variant)

d:entry.p: [also demand (= mi'ecpe); x4 is a means of expression (cf. ve cusku): a request may be indicated in speech, in writing, or by an action (e.g. petitions are often in writing, while begging/panhandling may be indicated by an action or even demeanor)]; (cf. pikci, te preti, te frati, se spuda, danfu)

d:entry.p: [also: x1 is a victor; x2 reward; x3 competitors here are opponents and in many situations, defeated/losers, vs. the set of those competing for a goal; x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event, or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= posyji'a, posyselji'a for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. cirko, jivna, talsa, cnemu, prali, pleji, sfasa, jdima, jerna, bradi, kargu, kelci)

tr.td: cf. 贏得 (赢得) [yíng dé] ``win; gain'' (compound)

tr.td: correct transcription ``butilk''; cf. винная бутылка [vinnaâ butylka] ``winebottle (Russian volume unit ~ 768.75 millilitres)''; cf. водочная бутылка [vodočnaâ butylka] ``vodkabottle (Russian volume unit ~ 615 millilitres)''

d:entry.p: [also impresses; x4 is alluring (= trivelxlu for place reordering); x3 may be an achieved action/state, or an attempt to perform an action/enter a state)]; (x3 and x4 are normally events or states); (cf. djica, mukti, trina, jitro, sazri, tcica, xance, stidi, kajde, maksi)

ul.li: x1 is a ski/skid/skate/runner for surface (of material) x2 supporting skier/skater/sled/cargo x
x1 is the weight of object x2 in [gravitational or other force] field x3

tr.td: cf. 權重 (权重) [quán zhòng] ``weight'' (compound); cf. 重量 [zhòng liàng] ``weight'' (compound)

ul.li: x1 is a structure word of grammatical class x2, with meaning/function x3 in usage (language) x4

d:entry.p: [x4 may be a specific usage (with an embedded language place) or a massified language description; x3 and x4 may be merely an example of cmavo usage or refer to an actual expression; cmavo list, if physical object (= (loi) ma'oste); referring to the mental construct (e.g. propose adding a new cmavo to the cmavo list = ma'orpoi, ma'orselcmi, ma'orselste)]; (cf. gismu, lujvo, gerna, smuni, valsi)

ul.li: x1 uses levity/is non-serious/frivolous about x2 (abstraction)
x1 is stubborn/willfully opposing/resisting x2 about x3 (event/state)

d:entry.p: [x2 may be a person, a state or condition, or a force; the essence is willful resistance]; (cf. tinsa, pante, bapli, fapro)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
re'e
cmavo ( selma'o: UI4 )

location tense relation/direction

ul.li: x1 (du'u) is false/is an untruth by standard/epistemology/metaphysics x2

d:entry.p: [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place]; (cf. fatci, stace, jetnu, cfika)

tr.td: fake; false; artificial; to borrow; if; suppose

ul.li: x1 [sequence] is in reverse order from x2 [sequence]
x1 (object) is inverted from x2 (object)

d:entry.p: [also opposite (one sense)]; (cf. cmavo list fa'e, dukti)

ul.li: x1 knows fact(s) x2 (du'u) about subject x3 by epistemology x4

d:entry.p: [words usable for epistemology typically have a du'u place; know how to - implying knowledge of method but not necessarily having the ability to practice (= tadjyju'o)] (cf. know/familiar with: se slabu, na'e cnino, na'e fange; cmavo list du'o, cilre, certu, facki, jijnu, jimpe, senpi, smadi, kakne, birti, mipri, morji, saske, viska)

ul.li: x1 [hours, {minutes}, {seconds}] is the time/hour of state/event x2 on day x3 at location x4

d:entry.p: [also o'clock, time-of-day]; (time units in x1 are specified as numbers separated by pi'e or are unit values massified with joi); (cf. cmavo list ti'u, cacra, cerni, detri, donri, djedi, junla, nicte, mentu, snidu, temci, vanci, dirba, mokca)

x1 hears x2 against background/noise x3
x2 is audible

d:entry.p: (cf. kerlo, sance, smaji, savru, voksa, ganse, zgana)

d:entry.p: [also spread, shared out, apportioned; agentive distribution (= fairgau, fairzu'e)]; (cf. cmavo list fa'u, fendi, preja, katna, tcana)

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xecto, xexso, zepti, zetro)

x1 loses property/feature x2 in conditions/situation x3

d:entry.p: [x2 may be a specific object, a commodity (mass), an event (rare for cirko), or a property; pedantically, for objects/commodities, this is sumti-raising from ownership of the object/commodity (= po'ecri, posyselcri for unambiguous semantics)]; (cf. facki, ralte, sisku, claxu, jinga, pleji, canja, sfasa, dapma, binra, mipri)

d:entry.p: (cf. skari, blabi, xekri, kandi, carmi, crino, blanu)

x1 is immaterial/not physical/without material form

Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is English/pertains to English-speaking culture in aspect x2

d:entry.p: [generally assume broadest sense of 'English'; may refer to 'English', pertaining to the country/people/culture of England (normally requiring constraint = gligu'e, or simply redundancy = gligli-); British English, the norm language of the UK (= gliglibau)]; (cf. brito which refers to the United Kingdom as a whole or to the British empire, merko, sralo, kadno, skoto)

ul.li: x1 is a line/among lines [1-dimensional shape/form] defined by set of points x2

d:entry.p: [ray/vector (farli'i or porli'i)]; (cf. kruvi, sirji, jganu, kantu, mokca)

ul.li: x1 hates/despises x2 (object/abstraction)
x1 is full of hate for x2
x2 is odious to x1

d:entry.p: [x1 is hateful (one sense); x2 is hateful (different sense)]; (cf. djica, nitcu, rigni, prami, nelci)

ul.li: x1 (site/event) is a source/start/beginning/origin of x2 (object/event/process)

d:entry.p: [also root (figurative sense); (adjective:) x1 is initial]; (cf. fanmo, cmavo list ra'i, sabji, cfari, jipno, traji, kojna, genja, jicmu, sitna, jinto)

tr.td: cf. 開端 (开端) [kāi duān] ``start'' (compound); cf. 開始 (开始) [kāi shǐ] ``start'' (compound)

ul.li: x1 [agent] shoves/pushes x2 at locus x3

d:entry.p: [move by pushing/shoving (= ca'ermuvgau)]; (cf. danre for non-agentive force, lacpu)

ul.li: x1 is big/large in property/dimension(s) x2 (ka) as compared with standard/norm x3

d:entry.p: (cf. banli, clani, ganra, condi, plana, cmalu, rotsu, banro, xanto)

ul.li: x1 is a boy/lad [young male person] of age x2 immature by standard x3

d:entry.p: [word dispreferred in metaphor/example as sexist; (use verba)]; (cf. nixli, verba, nanmu, bersa)

d:entry.p: [for x1 force, it is a force acting as a blade, not acting upon a blade; agentive cutting (= ka'argau, ka'arzu'e)]; (cf. kakpa, sraku for cutting into without division; plixa, dakfu, jinci, porpi, spofu, tunta, xrani, fatri, fendi, balre, dilcu)

d:entry.p: (cf. grake, mitre, snidu, stero, delno, molro, kelvo, xampo, gradu. litce, merli, centi, decti, dekto, femti, gigdo, gocti, gotro, kilto, megdo, mikri, milti, nanvi, petso, picti, terto, xatsi, xexso, zepti, zetro)

d:entry.p: (x2 interval should be the defining boundaries; if merely a characterizing period, the nature of the interval should be expressed in an abstract bridi, or the interval should be marked with tu'a; x2 may also be characteristic object(s) or practices of the era, if marked with tu'a); (cf. ranji, temci, citsi)

d:entry.p: [implies some relative degree of fullness will result; agentive filling (= tisyse'a, tisygau, tisyzu'e); inflate/become inflated/blow up (= gacytisna, agentive gacyse'a); pour into (= liktisna, agentive likse'a)]; (cf. culno, kunti, rinci, setca)

tr.td: cf. 窴 [tián] ``fill in'' (variant); cf. 闐 (阗) [tián] ``fill up'' (variant); cf. 添 [tiān] ``replenish'' (variant)

d:entry.p: [also medic; (adjective:) x1, x4 is medical; x2 is a patient of x1 (= selmikce for reordered places) ; x2 is treated by x1 person/x4 treatment/method; successfully cure transitive (= sadmikce, sadvelmikce), intransitive (= sadyselmikce, ka'orbi'o to not imply an external agent/process, though the x1 and x4 of mikce may be self/internal); treatment (= velmikce)]; (cf. bilma, kanro, spita)

[automated apparatus, without direct function control]

d:entry.p: [also machinery/mechanism; a machine is initiated/triggered by an agent/force, but thereafter performs its function automatically; if self-directed, (a minji is an) entity (= zukte)]; (cf. cabra, matra, tutci, zukte, pilno, skami)

tr.td: cf. 機器 (机器) [jī qì] ``machine'' (compound); cf. 機械 (机械) [jī xiè] ``machine'' (compound)

x1 is a brush for purpose x2 (event) with bristles x3

d:dictionary.d:entry:
mo'izo'a
cmavo ( selma'o: FAhA* )
space motion tense: passing by a site directional space motion
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 is polite/courteous/civil in matter x2 according to standard/custom x3

tr.td: cf. 有禮貌 (有礼貌) [yǒu lǐ mào] ``polite'' (compound)

ul.li: x1 is a quantity of hemp/marijuana/jute of species/strain x2
x1 is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed x2
x1 is a market/store/exchange/shop(s) selling/trading (for) x2, operated by/with participants x

d:entry.p: [also: mall, marketplace, shopping center, cooperative, bazaar, trading post, mart; the concept is the function of selling/exchanging coupled with a location, and is more oriented to the larger concept of marketplace than the stalls/shops that comprise it, though it does not exclude the latter individual shops (= zaisle); x3 may include both owners/proprietors and customers in some markets, but in most contexts refers only to the operators]; (cf. vecnu, canja, dinju, banxa)

ul.li: x1 wears/is robed/garbed in x2 as a garment of type x3

d:entry.p: [x2 need not be intended for use as a garment (unlike taxfu)]; (cf. taxfu)

d:dictionary.d:entry:
mo'ite'e
cmavo ( selma'o: FAhA* )
space motion tense: moving along the border directional space motion
Frequency: undefined null

ul.li: x1 (agent) fastens/connects/attaches/binds/lashes x2 to x3 with fastener x4

d:entry.p: [no implication that result is considered a single object; although x2 and x3 may be reversible, x3 may be used for the substrate, the fixed/larger object to which x2 becomes attached];(cf. jorne, fenso, jgena, batke, dinko, kansa)

d:dictionary.d:entry:

tr.td: cf. 治理 [zhì lǐ] ``control'' (compound); cf. 制 [zhì] ``control'' (variant); cf. 管制 [guǎn zhì] ``control'' (variant compound)

d:entry.p: [explanation x4 is an underlying mechanism/details/purpose/method for x2 (= velcki for reordered places), generally assumed to be non-obvious; metaphorical usage with the various causal relations (i.e. jalge, mukti, krinu, rinka, nibli, zukte) is possible, but the non-obviousness, and the existence of an explainer with a point of view makes this word not a simple expression of cause]; (cf. cipra, danfu, jalge, jinvi, krinu, mukti, nabmi, preti, rinka, sidbo, zukte, tavla)

ul.li: x1 is old/familiar/well-known to observer x2 in feature x3 (ka) by standard x4

d:entry.p: [This can cover both meanings of old. Old in years, i.e. age, can be conveyed through x2 = the world, life, existence (= loi nu zasti); in usage this has been a common default for ellipsis. However slabu is not the opposite of 'young' (= nalci'o, tolci'o), but the opposite of 'new' (= tolni'o); also ancient (= tcesau), age (= nilsau); x2 is used to x1 (= selsau for reordered places); historic/historical (= cirsau, cirselcedra; also vaipru)]; (cf. clani, citno, cnino, se djuno; not the opposite of citno, djuno)

attitudinal: fear - security

ul.li: x1 is a pump/injector [tool/apparatus] pumping/inserting fluid x2 to x3 from x4 by means x5

d:entry.p: [x2 fluid may be liquid or gas; x5 may be a force; a pump generally causes a pressure gradient, such that x3 is a place of lower pressure, x4 a place of higher pressure]; (cf. gapci, litki, rinci; metaphorical use of fepri for gas, risna for liquid, rinci, tutci)
